news.title: Labour is cosying up to China after years of rollercoaster relations
news.summary: To some closer ties are a smart economic opportunity, to others there are fears it could risk national security. But either way, is the UK lacking a playbook?

news.title: Man killed in racist attack told police he saw similar assault weeks before death
news.summary: Another Asian man was assaulted by two boys two weeks before Bhim Kohli was fatally attacked.

news.title: Chancellor to announce £15bn for transport projects outside London
news.summary: Money will be spent on tram, train and bus projects in England across the Midlands, North and West Country.

news.title: Police investigate heart deaths at NHS hospital
news.summary: Patients who died at Castle Hill Hospital near Hull may have suffered avoidable harm, documents suggest.

news.title: 'Review into my daughter's killing has been hell on earth'
news.summary: The reviews aim to prevent future attacks but just 1% are completed on time, BBC research suggests.

news.title: RAF chief Sir Richard Knighton to lead armed forces
news.summary: Sir Richard Knighton is set to replace Admiral Sir Tony Radakin as next Chief of the Defence Staff.

news.title: The Papers: 'Good weather' small boat surge and 'tax bombshells'
news.summary: A mix of stories makes up the front pages, including a surge in small boats crossings.

news.title: South Korea's new president has a Trump-shaped crisis to avert
news.summary: Lee Jae-myung secured a storming victory, but his honeymoon will barely last the day.

news.title: Author Bernardine Evaristo 'astonished' to receive one-off £100k prize
news.summary: The trailblazing novelist says she will use the £100,000 prize money to support other female writers.

news.title: Why time is right for resilient 'Mini Messi' Kirby to end England career
news.summary: Fran Kirby's international career epitomised what resilience, combined with serious talent, can accomplish but the time is right to retire, writes Emma Sanders.
